meanings.definition: A protein that is a major component of the extracellular matrix in animals.
meanings.sent1: The laminin in our bodies provides structure and support to our cells.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study laminin to understand how it contributes to the structure of living organisms.
meanings.sent3: The laminin protein decided to hold hands with other proteins to form a strong network.
meanings.sent4: Like a scaffold, laminin holds everything together in the animal kingdom.
meanings.sent5: Imagine laminin as the glue that holds the animal cells in place, like a molecular adhesive.

meanings.definition: A glycoprotein that helps cells adhere to one another and to the extracellular matrix.
meanings.sent1: Laminin plays a crucial role in ensuring cells stick together and form tissues.
meanings.sent2: Cells rely on laminin to maintain connections with each other and their surroundings.
meanings.sent3: The laminin glycoprotein acted as a friendly glue, bringing cells closer together.
meanings.sent4: In the cellular world, laminin acts as a molecular handshake between neighboring cells.
meanings.sent5: Picture laminin as the cellular Velcro that keeps cells attached and organized in the body.
